instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.R7051: What is R7051? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7005: What is R7005? resistor between charger and CHGR_DCIN pin of ISL6259, if CHGR_DCIN is low then this resistor is probably blown. When PPBUS_G3H is low or missing this is something to check if your model has CHGR_DCIN along R7005. .
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.ALL_SYS: What is ALL_SYS? This is a typo of ALL_SYS_PWRGD When you see ALL_SYS, assume they meant to type ALL_SYS_PWRGD.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> trying to power up but fan move only 2mm
threads.message: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> . goy it with no green light on charger and on battery connector 12v was missing . replaced <RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR> coz was faulty and <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> also <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7035</TRANSISTOR> now i have 5v jumping bettwen 12v on battery connector and fan trying to start up but no result. any idea?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> trying to power up but fan move only 2mm
threads.message: check value for <RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR> and resistance between pins 17-18 and 27-28 from <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>, report values.....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> trying to power up but fan move only 2mm
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> trying to power up but fan move only 2mm
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> trying to power up but fan move only 2mm
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> trying to power up but fan move only 2mm
threads.message: So <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS</SIGNAL> is not pulsing up when the fan moves? That means some rail is not coming on. Check on all coils which one is not pulsing. CPU Vcore and AXG excepted of course.
